verses.verse: And they came <WG2064> over to the other <WG4008> side <WG4008> of the sea, <WG2281> into <WG1519> the country <WG5561> of the Gadarenes. <WG1046>
And when he was come <WG1831> out of the ship, <WG4143> immediately <WG2112> there met <WG528> him out of the tombs <WG3419> a man <WG444> with an unclean <WG169> spirit, <WG4151>
Who <WG3739> had <WG2192> his dwelling <WG2731> among <WG1722> the tombs; <WG3419> and no <WG3762> man <WG3762> could <WG1410> bind <WG1210> him, no, <WG3777> not with chains: <WG254>

Because <WG1223> that he had been often <WG4178> bound <WG1210> with fetters <WG3976> and chains, <WG254> and the chains <WG254> had been plucked <WG1288> asunder <WG1288> by him, and the fetters <WG3976> broken <WG4937> in pieces: neither <WG2532> <WG3762> could <WG2480> any <WG3762> man tame <WG1150> him.
And always, <WG1275> night <WG3571> and day, <WG2250> he was in the mountains, <WG3735> and in the tombs, <WG3418> crying, <WG2896> and cutting <WG2629> himself <WG1438> with stones. <WG3037>
But when he saw <WG1492> Jesus <WG2424> afar <WG3113> off, <WG575> he ran <WG5143> and worshipped <WG4352> him,

And cried <WG2896> with a loud <WG3173> voice, <WG5456> and said, <WG2036> What <WG5101> have I to do with you, Jesus, <WG2424> you Son <WG5207> of the most <WG5310> high <WG5310> God? <WG2316> I adjure <WG3726> you by God, <WG2316> that you torment <WG928> me not.
For he said <WG3004> to him, Come <WG1831> out of the man, <WG444> you unclean <WG169> spirit. <WG4151>
And he asked <WG1905> him, What <WG5101> is your name? <WG3686> And he answered, <WG611> saying, <WG3004> My name <WG3686> is Legion: <WG3003> for we are many. <WG4183>
And he sought <WG3870> him much <WG4183> that he would not send <WG649> them away <WG649> out of the country. <WG5561>
Now <WG1161> there <WG1563> was there near <WG4314> to the mountains <WG3735> a great <WG3173> herd <WG34> of swine <WG5519> feeding. <WG1006>
And all <WG3956> the devils <WG1142> sought <WG3870> him, saying, <WG3004> Send <WG3992> us into <WG1519> the swine, <WG5519> that we may enter <WG1525> into <WG1519> them.

And immediately <WG2112> Jesus <WG2424> gave <WG2010> them leave. <WG2010> And the unclean <WG169> spirits <WG4151> went <WG1831> out, and entered <WG1525> into <WG1519> the swine: <WG5519> and the herd <WG34> ran <WG3729> violently down <WG2596> a steep <WG2911> place into <WG1519> the sea, <WG2281> (they were about <WG5613> two <WG1367> thousand; <WG1367>) and were choked <WG4155> in the sea. <WG2281>

And they that fed <WG1006> the swine <WG5519> fled, <WG5343> and told <WG312> it in the city, <WG4172> and in the country. <WG68> And they went <WG1831> out to see <WG1492> what <WG5101> it was that was done. <WG1096>

And they come <WG2064> to Jesus, <WG2424> and see <WG2334> him that was possessed <WG1139> with the devil, <WG1139> and had <WG2192> the legion, <WG3003> sitting, <WG2521> and clothed, <WG2439> and in his right <WG4993> mind: <WG4993> and they were afraid. <WG5399>
And they that saw <WG1492> it told <WG1334> them how <WG4459> it befell <WG1096> to him that was possessed <WG1139> with the devil, <WG1139> and also concerning <WG4012> the swine. <WG5519>
And they began <WG756> to pray <WG3870> him to depart <WG565> out of their coasts. <WG3725>
And when he was come <WG1684> into <WG1519> the ship, <WG4143> he that had been possessed <WG1139> with the devil <WG1139> prayed <WG3870> him that he might be with him.

However, Jesus <WG2424> suffered <WG863> him not, but said <WG3004> to him, Go <WG5217> home <WG3624> to your friends, <WG4674> and tell <WG312> them how <WG3745> great <WG3745> things the Lord <WG2962> has done <WG4160> for you, and has had compassion <WG1653> on you.

And he departed, <WG565> and began <WG756> to publish <WG2784> in Decapolis <WG1179> how <WG3745> great <WG3745> things Jesus <WG2424> had done <WG4160> for him: and all <WG3956> men did marvel. <WG2296>

And when Jesus <WG2424> was passed <WG1276> over <WG1276> again <WG3825> by ship <WG4143> to the other <WG4008> side, <WG4008> much <WG4183> people <WG3793> gathered <WG4863> to him: and he was near <WG3844> to the sea. <WG2281>

And, behold, <WG2400> there comes <WG2064> one <WG1520> of the rulers <WG752> of the synagogue, <WG752> Jairus <WG2383> by name; <WG3686> and when he saw <WG1492> him, he fell <WG4098> at <WG4314> his feet, <WG4228>

And sought <WG3870> him greatly, <WG4183> saying, <WG3004> My little <WG2365> daughter <WG2365> lies <WG2192> at the point <WG2079> of death: <WG2079> I pray you, come <WG2064> and lay <WG2007> your hands <WG5495> on <WG2007> her, that she may be healed; <WG4982> and she shall live. <WG2198>
And Jesus went <WG565> with him; and much <WG4183> people <WG3793> followed <WG190> him, and thronged <WG4918> him.
And a certain woman, <WG1135> which had <WG1510> an issue <WG4511> of blood <WG129> twelve <WG1427> years, <WG2094>

And had suffered <WG3958> many <WG4183> things of many <WG4183> physicians, <WG2395> and had spent <WG1159> all <WG3956> that she had, <WG3844> and was nothing <WG3367> bettered, <WG5623> but rather <WG3123> grew <WG2064> worse, <WG5501>
When she had heard <WG191> of Jesus, <WG2424> came <WG2064> in the press <WG3793> behind, <WG3693> and touched <WG680> his garment. <WG2440>
For she said, <WG3004> If <WG2579> I may touch <WG680> but his clothes, <WG2440> I shall be whole. <WG4982>
And straightway <WG2112> the fountain <WG4077> of her blood <WG129> was dried <WG3583> up; and she felt <WG1097> in her body <WG4983> that she was healed <WG2390> of that plague. <WG3148>

And Jesus, <WG2424> immediately <WG2112> knowing <WG1921> in himself <WG1438> that virtue <WG1411> had gone <WG1831> out of him, turned <WG1994> him about <WG1994> in the press, <WG3793> and said, <WG3004> Who <WG5101> touched <WG680> my clothes? <WG2440>
And his disciples <WG3101> said <WG3004> to him, You see <WG991> the multitude <WG3793> thronging <WG4918> you, and say <WG3004> you, Who <WG5101> touched <WG680> me?
And he looked <WG4017> round <WG4017> about <WG4017> to see <WG1492> her that had done <WG4160> this <WG5124> thing.

But the woman <WG1135> fearing <WG5399> and trembling, <WG5141> knowing <WG1492> what <WG3739> was done <WG1096> in her, came <WG2064> and fell <WG4363> down before <WG4363> him, and told <WG2036> him all <WG3956> the truth. <WG225>
And he said <WG2036> to her, Daughter, <WG2364> your faith <WG4102> has made <WG4982> you whole; <WG4982> go <WG5217> in peace, <WG1515> and be whole <WG5199> of your plague. <WG3148>

While he yet <WG2089> spoke, <WG2980> there came <WG2064> from the ruler <WG752> of the synagogue's <WG752> house certain which said, <WG3004> Your daughter <WG2364> is dead: <WG599> why <WG5101> trouble <WG4660> you the Master <WG1320> any <WG2089> further? <WG2089>

As soon <WG2112> as Jesus <WG2424> heard <WG191> the word <WG3056> that was spoken, <WG2980> he said <WG3004> to the ruler <WG752> of the synagogue, <WG752> Be not afraid, <WG5399> only <WG3440> believe. <WG4100>
And he suffered <WG863> no <WG3762> man <WG3762> to follow <WG4870> him, save <WG1508> Peter, <WG4074> and James, <WG2385> and John <WG2491> the brother <WG80> of James. <WG2385>
And he comes <WG2064> to the house <WG3624> of the ruler <WG752> of the synagogue, <WG752> and sees <WG2334> the tumult, <WG2351> and them that wept <WG2799> and wailed <WG214> greatly. <WG4183>
And when he was come <WG1525> in, he said <WG3004> to them, Why <WG5101> make <WG2350> you this ado, <WG2350> and weep? <WG2799> the damsel <WG3813> is not dead, <WG599> but sleeps. <WG2518>

And they laughed <WG2606> him to scorn. <WG2606> But when he had put <WG1544> them all <WG537> out, he takes <WG3880> the father <WG3962> and the mother <WG3384> of the damsel, <WG3813> and them that were with him, and enters <WG1531> in where <WG3699> the damsel <WG3813> was lying. <WG345>

And he took <WG2902> the damsel <WG3813> by the hand, <WG5495> and said <WG3004> to her, Talitha <WG5008> cumi; <WG2891> which <WG3739> is, being interpreted, <WG3177> Damsel, <WG2877> I say <WG3004> to you, arise. <WG1453>

And straightway <WG2112> the damsel <WG2877> arose, <WG450> and walked; <WG4043> for she was of the age of twelve <WG1427> years. <WG2094> And they were astonished <WG1839> with a great <WG3173> astonishment. <WG1611>
And he charged <WG1291> them straightly <WG4183> that no <WG3367> man <WG3367> should know <WG1097> it; and commanded <WG2036> that something should be given <WG1325> her to eat. <WG5315>
